result.execSummary:
The defendant Leah A Blando was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Writings or Objects, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Maintain full time employment, schooling or a combination of both for at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.

Absolute Sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with pre-authorization of agent. 

Participate in any assessment, treatment and counseling as deemed appropriate by the department. 

DNA Sample. 

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

superMiscConds.notes:
Assessment, treatment, counseling as recommended. 

AODA and follow up.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Case called: 11:17 am
INCLUDES 18CF1418, 18CF1417, 16CF600, 15CF1104, 14CF1002.
Clerk: Kassidi.
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo:
Defendant appears in custody and with Atty Joseph Kaupie;
PLEA HEARING IN 18CF418 & 18CF1417:
VRCW. Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Counsel filed. State moves to:
18CF1418:
Ct. 1>> Delete 'Deliver/Distribute Methamphetamine On or Near Certain Places' Enhancer.
Ct. 2 (Possession of Controlled Substance-Repeater)>>DRI.

18CF1417:
Ct. 3 (Maintain Drug Trafficking Place-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 4 (Possession of Narcotic Drugs-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 5 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia to Manufacture, Compound, Convert, Produce, or Store Methamphetamine-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 6 (Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense)-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 7 (Possess/Ilegally Obtained Prescription-Repeater)>>DRI.
Ct. 8 (Possess Drug Paraphernalia-Repeater)>>DRI.
COURT GRANTS ABOVE.

PLEA:
18CF1418:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>3-10g)-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> NO CONTEST.

18CF1417:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent- Amphetamine (>10-50g)-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> NO CONTEST.

Ct. 2 (Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony-Repeater)>> NO CONTEST.

Crt advises def of rights & penalties & ques def to understanding.  Crt finds plea & waiver freely & vol made, a factual basis & def guilty.  

COURT ORDERS: 
18CF1418:
Ct. 1 (Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine (>3-10g)-Repeater-Second and Subsequent Offense)>> 9.5 Years WSPS, 4.5 Years IC and 5 Years ES, Concurrent to all cases. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, Maintain Full time work/School or a combination, Pay outstanding Court Obligations. Court finds 189 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming. 

18CF1417:

CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, Maintain Full time work/School or a combination, Pay outstanding Court Obligations. Court finds 189 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming. 

Ct. 2 (Possess Firearm-Convicted of a Felony-Repeater)>> 9.5 Years WSPS, 4.5 Years IC and 5 Years ES, Concurrent to all cases. CONDITIONS: Assessment/treatment/counseling as recommended, AODA and Follow, Absolute Sobriety from Controlled Substances, Maintain Full time work/School or a combination, Pay outstanding Court Obligations. Court finds 189 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming. 


SENTENCING HEARING ON REVOCATION ON 14CF1002, 15CF1104, 16CF600:

Ct. 1 (Forgery-Writings or Objects-Repeater)>> 6 Years WSPS, 3 Years IC and 3 Years ES, Concurrent to all cases. Court finds 351 Days Credit. Defendant is eligible for SAP and CIP Programming.

Case Called: 9:00 am 
INCLUDES 14CF502 AND 14CF1002. 
State appears by ADA Kyle Mayo; Def appears in person, in custody with Atty Kyle Reimann. 
State notes parties have reached agreement in these files. VRCW. 
Atty Reimann makes statement re: sentencing. Def makes statement prior to sentencing. 

WAIVER OF PRELIM IN 14CF1002. 
Waiver of Prelim. filed. 
Court questions deft as to waiver. 
Court finds waiver freely and voluntarily made. 
COURT finds PC - Defendant bound over for arraignment & trial. 

MOTION TO REVOKE DEOJ  IN 14CF502. 
State moves to revoke DEOJ. COURT grants. 
COURT enters judgment on Ct. 1 (Possession of Methamphetamine) and finds def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: On Ct. 1>>SWH for 2 years probation to run concurrent to probation in 14CF1002 - CONDITIONS: 4 months MCJ imposed and STAYED for rule violations; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with pre-authorization of agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 for at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; DNA sample and surcharge if not already done; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 75 days jail credit if revoked. 
     
SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION IN 14CF502. 
COURT ORDERS: On Cts. 2 & 3>>90 days MCJ to run concurrent with 75 days credit for time served and payment of court costs.   

PLEA HEARING IN 14CF1002. 
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. 
State moves to: 
Ct. 1 (Forgery-Writings or Objects/Repeater)>>DELETE Repeater enhancer. 
Ct. 2 (Forgery-Writings or Objections/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
Ct. 3 (Felony BJ/Repeater)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 
PLEA: Amended Ct. 1 (Forgery-Writings or Objects)>>NO CONTEST. 
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: SWH for 2 years probation to run concurrent to probation in 14CF502 - CONDITIONS: assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the dept; AODA; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with pre-authorization of agent; maintain fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 for at least 30 hours per week or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; DNA sample and surcharge if not already done; payment of court costs. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to 75 days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 9:20 am
Review hearing February 3, 2015 at 8:45 am
